isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - TROUBLESHOOTING - GENERAL TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: The symptoms listed in this section relate to specific events rather than specific diagnostic codes. It is still a necessary first step to read (and note) any active or inactive diagnostic codes.

svcsubproc.title: Vehicle Will Not Start (Will Not Crank)

step1.para: Perform the following checks. If no defects are found, proceed to Step 2.

step2.para: Check vehicle starting system cables and wires for clean, tight connections. Check circuit 136 connection to B+ terminal of crank motor solenoid for clean, tight connection.

step1.para: Check ECU battery and ignition voltage and ECU grounds by performing TEST 1. If defects are noted when performing this test, perform additional tests as directed (TESTS 1A, 1B, OR 1C).

step2.para: If battery and ignition voltage to ECU are to specifications and the ground circuits check good, proceed to Step 3.
If defects were noted in battery, ignition or ground circuits to ECU, correct defects and retest start system.

step1.para: Perform TEST 2 - TESTING NEUTRAL START SYSTEM.

step2.para: IF neutral start system checks good, proceed to Step 4.
If defects were noted in neutral start system, correct defects and test for proper engine starting.

step1.para: Check the Shift Selector circuits by performing TEST 3. (The shift selector may not be communicating properly to the ECU that the shift selector is in the neutral position.)

step2.para: If shift selector circuits check good, go to Step 5.
If defects are noted in shift circuits, correct condition and test for proper engine starting.

step1.para: Check the Shift Selector operation using the Pro-link DDR. If a Pro-Link DDR is not available, and the shift selector circuits checked good (Step 4), replace the shift selector.
If the no-start condition is still present after performing steps 1 through 5, have an Allison dealer continue the diagnosis.

svcsubproc.title: "DO NOT SHIFT" Light Will Not Go Out At Startup
svcsubproc.para: The "Do Not Shift" light should be illuminated when the key is turned to the ON position and then go out when the vehicle is started. If a diagnostic code is registered because of a condition detected by the ECU that will "inhibit" transmission operation, the shift light should illuminate (refer to diagnostic code list for those codes that cause the "Do Not Shift" Light to illuminate).

step1.para: Determine if transmission operation is inhibited.

step2.para: If transmission operation is inhibited and diagnostic code is present, perform diagnostics as indicated by the code.
If transmission is not inhibited, go to Step 2.

step1.para: Perform TEST 4 - TESTING DO NOT SHIFT LIGHT GROUND CIRCUIT TO ECU.

step2.para: If ground circuit to ECU is defective, make necessary repairs.
If ground circuit to ECU is not defective, have Allison dealer diagnose the ECU for proper operation.

svcsubproc.title: "Do Not Shift" Warning Light Does Not Illuminate During Startup.
svcsubproc.para: Perform TEST 4 - TESTING THE DO NOT SHIFT LIGHT CIRCUIT.

svcsubproc.title: Panel Light Dimmer Does Not Control Electronic Shifter Light Intensity.
svcsubproc.para: Perform TEST 5 - TESTING PANEL LIGHT VOLTAGE TO ECU

svcsubproc.title: Vehicle Backup Lights (Reverse Warning) Do Not Function.
svcsubproc.para: If power to the backup lights is not present at Junction Block J4-4, perform TEST 5 - TESTING BACKUP LIGHT RELAY SYSTEM.

svcsubproc.title: Vehicle Speedometer Fails To Operate.
svcsubproc.para: If the speedometer fails to operate (tachometer operates normally) and the input signal is suspected, check for diagnostic codes from the ECU first.

step1.para: If no codes are present, perform TEST 7 - TEST FOR SPEEDOMETER SIGNAL FROM ECU.
If codes are present refer to TROUBLESHOOTING WITH DIAGNOSTIC CODES.

svcsubproc.title: WITH ABS BRAKE SYSTEM - If Transmission Will Not Go Into "Lockup" Mode (Or Transmission Retarder Will Not Engage If Equipped).
svcsubproc.para: If no diagnostic codes are present, check the ABS interface circuit by performing TEST 8 - TESTING WT TRANSMISSION TO ABS BRAKE CIRCUIT.

svcsubproc.title: Two-Speed Axle (Air Operated) With Allison WT
svcsubproc.para: The two-speed axle range is controlled the WT electronic control system by applying (or removing) voltage to the axle solenoid, which is a normally closed solenoid. Without voltage applied the axle solenoid is closed (no air applied to axle) and the axle will operate in low range. When voltage is applied to the solenoid, the solenoid energizes and air pressure through the solenoid causes the axle to shift to the high range.
If the two-speed axle only operates in the low range, perform TEST 9.
If the two-speed axle only operates in the high range, perform TEST 10.

svcsubproc.title: Williams Blue Ox Exhaust Brake
svcsubproc.para: Engine brake application is controlled the WT electronic control system by applying (or removing) voltage to the exhaust brake air solenoid, which is a normally closed solenoid. Without voltage applied the exhaust brake air solenoid is closed (exhaust brake not applied). When voltage is applied to the solenoid, the solenoid energizes and air pressure through the solenoid causes the exhaust brake to operate.
If the exhaust brake does not activate with the exhaust brake switch in the ON position, perform TEST 11.
If the exhaust brake operates with the exhaust brake switch in the ON position, perform TEST 12.
